result.execSummary:
The defendant Kurt C. Clendenning was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kurt C. Clendenning

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kurt C. Clendenning in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:09 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

There is an amended information.
Atty Dalkert has received a copy of the amended information.

There is a plea agreement.

Defendant will plead to Count 1.
Count 2 will be dismissed and read in.

State recommends a fine of $300 plus court costs.

Atty Dalkert concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY, amended Count 1.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Dalkert for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Amended Count, contrary to the statute section stated therein
State moves to amend the amended information for Count 1 to include the party to the crime enhancer - 939.05
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein, which also includes pary to the crime
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Dalkert makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Amended Count 1:
Pay a fine of $300 plus costs
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge
60 days to pay or set up payment plan

20 days in which to appeal, if wish.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

(15CF293) Defendant Caroline F Clendenning in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. 
(15CF292) Defendant Kurt C Clendenning in Court with attorney Melissa Dalkert. 
Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF292 & 15CF293

Atty Cousins requests permission to conduct a joint preliminary hearing. 
Atty Dalkert concurs. 

Detective B. Noel is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Cousins. 
Cross exam by Atty Dalkert. 
Cross exam by Atty Kessler.

Atty Cousins makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Dalkert makes arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kessler makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and these defendants committed it and binds the defendants over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  *On court dates.

Defendant Kurt C. Clendenning in court with attorney Melissa H. Dalkert. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

State recommends a $2,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Dalkert makes arguments re: bond.  
Court questions Atty Dalkert.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
